@carlosmiranda please help, the task is yours

@aistomin, I believe you're raising three different issues here. I'll explain one-by-one:
1. In the `JsonObject` parameter of `MkContents.create()`, `ref` is optional for consistency with the specification of the [file creation request of the Github REST API](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#create-a-file). For `MkContents`, the assumed default is `master` which I think is reasonable. I think we should only have one `create()` method as the `JsonObject` can already contain all possible parameters - it would be redundant if we have another method that has `branch/ref` and another one that does not. We are accepting `JsonObject` because of the large number of possible parameters. See our library's [design conventions](github.jcabi.com/apidocs-0.8.1/com/jcabi/github/package-summary.html#package_description).
2. Regarding `MkContents.get()`, it seems like the Github REST API does not really require `ref` from the [get content request](https://developer.github.com/v3/repos/contents/#get-contents). On our side, it's a problem with the `Contents` interface in general and _all_ of our `Contents` implementations should follow suit, not just `MkContents`. It would be best to raise a separate ticket so that this can be addressed at the appropriate level.
3. You are absolutely correct with the duplication of behavior in `MkContents.readme()`, I will update this as per your suggestion.
Pull request is now ready for review: https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/pull/797

@carlosmiranda

@aistomin , new ticket has been raised in #798 regarding the second concern. For the third one, a pull request is now available at #797.
